intro: Macromeria hispida, commonly known as the rough macromeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leaf structures. The plant features rough, hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow to orange in color, arranged in dense clusters. Macromeria hispida is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
